intro: Penstemon scariosus var. albifluvis, commonly known as the white river penstemon, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its tall, upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces pale pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, white pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping in arid regions.
